title: Celebrity X Factor: Brendan Cole's colourful love life and savage Strictly sacking
text:

Professional dancer Brendan Cole makes his TV return tonight on The X Factor : Celebrity, joining forces with actor Jeremy Edwards to see if they can impress the judges as a duo.

It comes 18 months after he was unceremoniously sacked from BBC One's Strictly Come Dancing , much to the shock of fans.

After all, like Anton Du Beke, he'd been around since the show's 2004 launch and even had the dubious honour of being the first person linked to the infamous 'Strictly Curse'.

Back then he was engaged to fellow pro Camilla Dallerup, but they called it off amid rumours he and celebrity partner Natasha Kaplinsky had grown close.

(Image: Sunday Mirror)

(Image: BBC)

Newsreader Natasha and Brendan both denied having an affair, while Camilla - who was paired with antiques expert David Dickinson - described their split as a 'mini-death'.

Then in 2018, Brendan broke his silence, hinting that he did get involved with Natasha - but only once his relationship was over.

"I’ve never talked about what relationship Natasha and I had on the show. What I did learn is that Strictly is not reality. It’s a television show where emotions are very much heightened," he told the Daily Mail.

"I didn’t cross any lines with Natasha. I was single. Camilla had ended the relationship very early on in the series so what happened happened after that.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: DAVID VENNI)

"It was a harrowing time - winning the show as much as my friendship with Natasha. On the other hand it was like, Holy Moses. It can ruin a marriage so easily."

Meanwhile, Brendan, 43, also got into his fair share of spats with the judges over the years.

He once took aim at the salaries, insisting that despite working 14 hour days, he couldn't afford a car.

"My money from Strictly just about pays the bills. I don’t have a car. I would like to get one, but until then I'm on the Tube. I don't even own my house. I can't afford it. I rent where I live," he told Now magazine of his rumoured £35,000 salary.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

But judge Bruno Tonioli - who is believed to earn around £110,000 - had zero sympathy for the dancers, telling The Mirror: "Those are the terms of the negotiations. If you don’t like it, stop moaning and f**k off!"

Brendan was also rumoured to have been embroiled in a behind-the-scenes feud with head judge Shirley Ballas , after she scored the head judge job he'd been favourite for.

“Obviously everyone that was up for it would want it. It is an amazing opportunity in terms of a spot," he said at the time.

“It would have been a natural progression from being a dancer on the show. I was obviously disappointed that I didn’t get it but at the same time my place has always been a dancer on the show."

And James Jordan , who was a professional on the show alongside his wife Ola, took to Twitter to accuse the BBC of disliking anyone who 'has an opinion'.

"Just seen my mate @BrendanCole has not been asked back on Strictly," he wrote.

"Seems like they don’t want anyone on the show that has an opinion. Especially when he played a massive part in making the show what it is today.

"Wishing him all the best in his future endeavours. Will be missed."

Speaking about his departure from the show in January 2018, Brendan told ITV's Lorraine that his sacking was an 'editorial decision'.

"This is quite hard to talk about. The BBC haven’t renewed my contract – we get renewed year on year – and they made an editorial decision not to have me back on the show," he said.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

"I’m a little bit in shock. I’m quite emotional, a bit raw about it.

“I’ve always known this day would come... I’m sure I’ll never know the ins and outs. I’m a very strong character within the show, I have my strong views.”

He received the 'disappointing' news via a phone call, and said he only told the pros about his exit 10 minutes before appearing on Lorraine.

He also said wife Zoe Hobbs was 'upset' for him and that he would have preferred to have made the decision to leave himself, without being shoved out the door.

(Image: Getty)

He said: “It’s their decision, the powers that be within the BBC, they’ll have a vision of the show and I’m not part of the vision, that’s OK. Listen, I accept, you’ve got to accept what decisions are made.

“I would have preferred to have made the decision myself, but maybe I would never have made it because I love being on the show."

Brendan now lives in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire with British model Zoe and their daughter Aurelia, six, and one-year-old son Dante.
description: X Factor: Celebrity star Brendan Cole was the first person linked to the 'Strictly Curse' back in 2004
